problems.description: V8ish.  Start as per "Karst Low".  Finish all the way right on "Giantsbane".

problems.name: Karst Low
problems.description: Sit-start using slot-crimp.  A hard move leads into "Karst".  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Karst
problems.description: Stand-start using obvious, flat jug.  Follow jugs up and left, continuing to top of boulder via path of least resistance.  (FA Kyle Marco, 2013)

problems.name: The King in the North
problems.description: Stand-start using edges in a diagonal seam.  Head directly up the imposing prow above.

problems.name: Dark Waters
problems.description: Sit-start low in pit, using good edge.  Head up and left to join "Karst".  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Karst Insurance
problems.description: Stand start on the far left end of the block under "In Karst We Trust".  Using a high right-hand sidepull, lean out left to pull on and reach the "biscuit" pinch.  From here, a heady sequence up the blunt prow on technical feet and opposing edges and pinches gains flat jugs to top out.

problems.name: In Karst We Trust
problems.description: Highball with bad landing.  Stand-start using whatever you'd like at/around head-height (FA used a left-hand gaston divot about 7ft up, and a lower right-hand pinch).  Head straight up on good Karst pinches and sidepulls.  Crux comes near the top.  Easy mantle.

problems.name: Giantsbane
problems.description: Sit-start using low, sidepulling holds.  Head straight up.  (FA Kyle Marco, 2013)

problems.name: Old Man Frank
problems.description: V4. Sit-start using a good but smooth RH sidepull, and a LH on a blunt sidepull immediately above that. Reach up and left to the obvious dimple, then head up left again to the obvious edge. Topout up and left of the edge on the double-prow feature. A bit of a puzzle!  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Pinch Slab
problems.description: Start (but not sitting) on good holds, step up onto good flat ledge then follow the huge pinch rail to the lip. (FA: Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: The Crossing
problems.description: Start sitting on a boulder, with a hand on either side of the corner on good lip holds. Traverse up and left, mantling at the top of the boulder where the lip becomes horizontal. Fun, interesting holds.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: The Cutting Edge
problems.description: V6ish. Located ~20m east of the Lowensenf boulder. Sit-start with right-hand on a good sidepull low on the arete, and left-hand on a lower opposing edge in the face.Move up and left through a some technical moves on some good-but-sharp crimps.

problems.name: Abaddon sit
problems.description: V8.  Sit-start using a small, slick left-facing crimp low on the arête, and anything else at the same height or lower.  Move up and right, to join and finish on "Abaddon".

problems.name: Abaddon sit direct
problems.description: V6/7.  Start as per "Abaddon sit".  After the first move, head up and left, towards a blocky jug.

problems.name: Abaddon
problems.description: V6.  Stand-start, using a pair of side-by-side left-facing crimps/edges.  Move up and right, to the point of the steep arête, then back left to top out.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Slice of Life
problems.description: Stand-start with a high crimp for your left hand, and a low pocket in the overhang for your right.  Dyno, or bump, your right-hand to the horn on the lip.  Continue left to top out.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Slice of Life sit
problems.description: Sit-start using obvious incut right-hand sidepull, and either a sidepull crimp, or a pocket, for the left.  Gun for the arete, then up.

problems.name: The Mystery Direct
problems.description: V8/9.  Sit-start matched on obvious mini-jug. Move right-hand to a gaston, and crank to the lip from there.

problems.name: The Mystery
problems.description: V7ish. Sit-start using low right-hand sidepull, and left-hand on obvious mini-jug. Move up and right.

problems.name: Slice of Pie
problems.description: Sit-start using giant edge.  Climb straight up.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Dab and Bomb
problems.description: V3. Sit start in between two blocks at East arete of Evan's Cave. Left hand on incut pinch in your face and right hand on incut side pull.  Power up to lip and mantle.

problems.name: Lowensenf traverse
problems.description: V7.  Sit-start matched on arête.  Traverse low and right, eventually topping out at the prow.
V0.  Sit-start with left-hand on arete, and right-hand on edge.  Climb right side of arete. (FA Kyle Marco, 2016)

problems.name: The Omen
problems.description: V2. Sit-start in left side of pit, with left-hand on incut edge, and right-hand lower.  Climb up and left.  (FA Dan Anhorn/Kyle Marco/Trent Hoover, 2016.)

problems.name: Deli Delight
problems.description: V5/6.  Sit-start in right side of pit, with left-hand on angling edge/crimp, and right-hand on low, large sidepull rail.  Move directly up face.   (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: Lowensenf
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start under arete/prow, with left-hand on a good incut, and right-hand on a lower edge.  Move up, to top out the prow feature.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016.)

problems.name: Lowensenf Right
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start right of arete, with right-hand on high, sharp incut on rail, and left-hand on lower edge.  Climb up and right, onto slab, staying right of arete.  Both "Lowensenf" lines have been done from either start into either finish. (FA Dan Anhorn/Trent Hoover, 2016)

problems.name: No Stone Unturned
problems.description: V2ish. This problem is found in a north-facing cave/pit ~50m north of the Feed the Need boulder. Sit-start in cave, right-hand on good part of rail below lip, left hand anywhere lower. Move up and left to a good edge, then reach right to good hold around corner. Top out straight up.

problems.name: No Stone Unturned left
problems.description: V6/7. Sit-start as per "No Stone Unturned". Once you reach the good edges above the lip of the cave, move up and left to a hard-to-see crimp. A tricky high-step unlocks the reach to better holds and an easy topout.

problems.name: Sleight of Hand
problems.description: V5/6. Sit-start matched on obvious edge-rail. Move up and right.

problems.name: Magic Lab
problems.description: V1ish. Sit-start using obvious low edges. Climb the short arete.

problems.name: Suspension of Disbelief
problems.description: V7ish. Sit-start matched on obvious crimp-rail. Move up and left via some improbable beta.

problems.name: Desperado
problems.description: Start matched on waist-height rail.  Climb right, to holds around the arete.  Continue right, to top out in the gap between boulders.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Bananarama
problems.description: V4. Stand-start matched on large sloping rail. Move left to a good sidepull/edge, then up and right to lip. (FA Evan Erickson, 2014)

problems.name: Feed the Need
problems.description: Start using giant notch-sloper on the arete (blocked in picture by small boulder in foreground) and/or large, sloping edge in the middle of the face right of that.  Move up to the lip, traverse right to the hanging prow, and follow the prow up and right to top out.  (FA Kyle Marco, 2014)

problems.name: Fully Fed
problems.description: Climb "Feed the Need", but instead of topping-out the prow, continue traversing right, to the peak of the sloping lip.  Around 20 moves total, and very sustained (if not progressively harder).  Pumpy 5.12+ might be a more accurate assessment.

problems.name: Need for Speed
problems.description: V6. Sit-start using incut right-hand sidepull, and move straight up into "Feed the Need". (FA Evan Erickson, 2014)

problems.name: Peachy Pinch
problems.description: Sit-start matched on good, incut mini-jug.  Reach up to a fat pinch/sidepull, then pull to the lip. A tricky mantle awaits.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Cherry Pit
problems.description: Start with right-hand pinch on arete, left-hand sloping sidepull.  Climb the left side of the arete.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: The Skin of Your Teeth
problems.description: V8ish. Stand-start with left-hand high on arete, and right-hand anywhere lower.  Move up right to sharp crack, then continue right to finish on Bananarama.

problems.name: Bananarama
problems.description: V4. Stand-start matched on large sloping rail. Move left to a good sidepull/edge, then up and right to lip. (FA Evan Erickson, 2014)

problems.name: Bananarama sit
problems.description: V6/7. Sit-start matched on huge sloper-notch on corner. A couple of tough moves get you into the stand-start.

problems.name: The Hand That Feeds
problems.description: V9ish. Sit-start matched on large sloper-edge in middle of overhang. Traverse low and left, through the huge sloper notch, to get into the start of Bananarama, and finish by doing that problem. Tensiony and powerful.

problems.name: The Blessing
problems.description: Starts in a large flat-bottomed pit on the backside of the Feed the Need Boulder (to the left of Bananarama).  Sit-start with right on a low, sloping, horizontal rail, and left on the blackened end of the opposing sloping rail in the overhang. Compression moves on slopers lead to a long move to a good edge.  From here, it's a long way up on really good edges to the top of the boulder (15 or 16 feet?). Great holds, great movement, great resistance climbing on slopers.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Taco Justice
problems.description: Sit-start using good left-hand sidepull, and low right-hand edge.  Head straight up, through a thin, positive right-hand crimp.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Split Left
problems.description: An excellent line, demanding precision, power, and tension.  Unforgiving of sloppy movement!  Sit-start matched on black-stained feature in the middle of the face.  A couple of slippery crimps lead up and left to a good sidepull, and a dynamic finish.  Top out as per "The Right Right".  (FA Morgan Dunnet, 2014)

problems.name: Split Down the Middle
problems.description: Start as per "Split Left", but move right to a sharp gaston.  Finish up the right side of the arete.

problems.name: Splitting Hairs
problems.description: Start, and climb, as per "Split Down the Middle", but continue right, to the start of "Possibilizer".  Finish up that problem.

problems.name: Fight for the Right
problems.description: Sit-start with right hand on an edge (in some black-stained stone, just above a small rock), and left hand on a rounded crimp.  Make a couple of moves to join "The Right Right" at it's first crux move, then complete a more direct finish to that problem (up the right side of the arete).

problems.name: The Right Right
problems.description: Start on the huge flat start hold of "The Possibilizer", and head left and upward on small edges and pinches. Amazing movement.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: The Possibilizer
problems.description: Looks extremely easy, feels absolutely impossible, ends up being something inbetween.  Start matched on the ledge at torso height, just left of the crack.  Use the sharp arete (everything right of the crack is out), blank face, and magical powers to gain the lip of the boulder.  Nothing is impossible, if you can find a possibilizer!  (FA Kyle Marco, 2014)

problems.name: Doom Shroom
problems.description: Climb the face from a standing-start on the right.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Deadline
problems.description: Climb straight up, taking the arete with your left hand and face holds with your right. Fun and easy line.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Down to the Wire
problems.description: V4/5.  Sit-start as low and left as possible.  Traverse right, finishing on "Overdue".

problems.name: Past Time
problems.description: Starts on long edge about 2m right of "Deadline".  Heads straight up the face to an easier-than-it-looks lip encounter. Great line!

problems.name: Buckle Down
problems.description: V5/6.  Start as per "Buckle Up", but traverse low, to the start of "Past Time", finishing up that problem.

problems.name: Crunch Time
problems.description: V2/3.  Sit-start using good edges in the middle of the face.  Climb up through good edges, to flat jugs high on the face, topping out direct.

problems.name: Buckle Up
problems.description: V4.  Start as low and right as possible.  Traverse up and left, gaining an obvious, high rail.  Continue along this rail to join the finish of "Past Time".

problems.name: Down to the Wire
problems.description: V4/5.  Sit-start as low and left as possible.  Traverse right, finishing on "Overdue".

problems.name: Crunch Time
problems.description: V2/3.  Sit-start using good edges in the middle of the face.  Climb up through good edges, to flat jugs high on the face, topping out direct.

problems.name: Overdue
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start using good edges low on the right side of the face.  Climb up and a bit left, then back right to a huge jug, then a big move to the lip. The top out isn't as hard as it looks! A great collection of perfect 'Frank edges'!  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Buckle Up
problems.description: V4.  Start as low and right as possible.  Traverse up and left, gaining an obvious, high rail.  Continue along this rail to join the finish of "Past Time".

problems.name: Buckle Down
problems.description: V5/6.  Start as per "Buckle Up", but traverse low, to the start of "Past Time", finishing up that problem.

problems.name: Explosive Relaxation
problems.description: Stand-start with good right-hand sidepull in overhang and tiny left-hand crimp around arete.  Pull on and make some powerful moves to gain the lip of the prow.  Head left, around corner, to top out.  (FA Evan Erickson, 2015)

problems.name: Explosive Relaxation
problems.description: Stand-start with good right-hand sidepull in overhang and tiny left-hand crimp around arete.  Pull on and make some powerful moves to gain the lip of the prow.  Head left, around corner, to top out.  (FA Evan Erickson, 2015)

problems.name: The Traversty
problems.description: Crouch-start matched on v-notch feature.  Traverse the lip left, to join (and finish on) "Explosive Relaxation".  (FA Evan Erickson 2015)

problems.name: Bonk Choy
problems.description: Climb the slab right of the crack, using the arete.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Assez Facile
problems.description: About 5-meters away, and slightly to your right, when facing away from "Split Left". Sit-start at base of arete, matched on blunt nose. A couple of long reaches on good edges lead to an easy top out.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Escape Velocity
problems.description: Sit-start using decent right-hand edge, and anything at the same height or lower for the left-hand.  Climb directly out the short, powerful overhang.  Traverse right to top out.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Koopa Troopa
problems.description: Sit-start using left-hand dimple and right-hand incut.  Climb the arete.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: NIntendo 69
problems.description: Sit-start under roof, either matched low on left-facing rail, or left-hand on rail and right-hand low on arete.  Some burly moves get you out of the cave, leading to more burly moves on left-hand edges and right-hand slopers.  Did I say burly yet? (FA Evan Erickson, 2003)

problems.name: Genesis
problems.description: Start as per "Nintendo 69", but exit the right side of the cave, and move up the tricky face, with the arete on your left.  Finish by rocking onto the slab above.

problems.name: The Great Escape
problems.description: V6ish.  Sit-start using low right-hand undercling in crack, and whatever works for your left-hand.  Move directly up the thin face via a tricky undercling(s), a small crimp, an obvious rail feature, and the left arete.  Be cautious of the rock at your back.  The stand-start from the torso-height undercling is a good V5ish problem.

problems.name: Fatality
problems.description: V8/9.  Sit-start using good, low left-hand undercling, and a bad right-hand pinch about a foot up and right.  Cross right-hand up to another pinch, then bust left to gain better holds.

problems.name: Mortal Kombat
problems.description: Start, basically laying down, matched on the block feature at the base of the arete.  Head up and left, using a couple of small right hand edges around the arete, and a couple of fat, slopey pinches for your left.  Gain juggy edges, and head left to top out.

problems.name: Super Nintendo
problems.description: Start on sharp left-hand gaston, and (lower down) sharper right-hand crimp.  A sloping edge up and right, and hidden, blunt undercling up and left will help you navigate up to the lip encounter. (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Console
problems.description: Sit-start, using good right-facing sidepull.  Climb the left-side of the mini-arete.

problems.name: Handcuffed
problems.description: V3/4.  Sit-start using good holds low on the right-side of the arete.  Move up and left, climbing the left side of the arete.

problems.name: Unknown
problems.description: Old Marco/Erickson line.

problems.name: Unshackled
problems.description: V7ish.  Stand-start using high edges.  Move up left to jug, then head right into a set of left-facing holds.  Reach right for a hidden crimp, and commit to the big finish.

problems.name: Cracked left
problems.description: V4ish.  Sit-start matched on low, juggy rail.  Reach right-hand up to a triangular edge, then head left to top out.

problems.name: Cracked
problems.description: Start using lowest flat rail.  Head up and right to fractured jugs.  Top out above.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Handcuffed
problems.description: V3/4.  Sit-start using good holds low on the right-side of the arete.  Move up and left, climbing the left side of the arete.

problems.name: Smack Pinch
problems.description: V3.  Start as per "Lipsmacker", but head immediately left, to a low incut edge, then up and left through tricky corner feature.

problems.name: Lipsmacker
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start matched on jug.  Move up and left to slopey lip encounter.  (FA Evan Erickson)

problems.name: The Seam
problems.description: V0.  Start as per "Lipsmacker", but follow the seam up and over the lip.

problems.name: Unseamly
problems.description: V6.  Sit-start with right-hand on the left end of the low sloper complex, and left-hand on a small crimp gaston just beside.  Move up and left to join "The Seam".

problems.name: Smackdown
problems.description: V8/9.  Sit-start matched on sloper complex (left-hand on undercling pinch/meat-wrap, and right-hand on dimple of sloper).  Power straight up, joining the finish of "Smack Talk".

problems.name: Smack Talk Low
problems.description: V9.  Sit-start with good left hand sloper, and right hand undercling crimp (kind of hidden, deep in the cave).  Navigate up and rightwards. via strange and improbable moves and holds.  Finish as per "Smack Talk".

problems.name: Smack Talk direct
problems.description: V2.  Start as per "Smack Talk", but mantle directly onto the slab.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Smack Talk Deluxe
problems.description: V7.  Eliminate.  Start as per "Smack Talk", but follow the lip all the way left to finish on "Lip Smacker", skipping any holds in the seam.  (FA Knut Rokne, 2005)

problems.name: Smack Talk
problems.description: V6.  Start on the slopey jug on the far right of the lip.  Move left along the lip until you can gain, and top out on, the seam feature.

problems.name: Vlad's Slab Left
problems.description: V0. Climb up the middle of the left side of the slab.

problems.name: Vlad's Slab
problems.description: V0. This slab is on the backside of the large boulder to your right (and slightly behind you) when facing "Lipsmacker". Climb up the middle of the right side of the slab.

problems.name: Unnamed V4
problems.description: V4.  Start as per "Shadowlands", but move up and left.

problems.name: Shadowlands
problems.description: V7.  Sit-start way low and left, matched on massive flake jugs.  Traverse right, along the lip (staying below, and not using, the crack), topping out at the peak.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)

problems.name: The Great Mistake
problems.description: V2/3.  Sit-start using low, flat jugs.  Move up and left to lip, then a bit right to top out.

problems.name: Split Decision
problems.description: Start as per"Split Personality", but head up and left, rolling onto slab.  (FA Morgan Dunnet)

problems.name: Split Personality
problems.description: Sit-start using low sidepull jug, and/or face jug.  Climb right side of hanging arete to gain obvious offset rail.  Follow rail left to top out.  (FA Evan Erickson, 2007)

problems.name: Tomb Raider
problems.description: Super fun, unique problem in Frank!  Start matched on flat spot at far right end of lip.  Climb along the underside of the suspended dagger, using the lip on your right, and an opposing rail in the roof.  Juggier edges at the tip of the boulder lead to the topout.

problems.name: Cradle of Life
problems.description: Start as per "Tombraider".  Head immediately up the face above, via a tricky mantle.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Tomb Raider
problems.description: Super fun, unique problem in Frank!  Start matched on flat spot at far right end of lip.  Climb along the underside of the suspended dagger, using the lip on your right, and an opposing rail in the roof.  Juggier edges at the tip of the boulder lead to the topout.

problems.name: Cradle of Life
problems.description: Start as per "Tombraider".  Head immediately up the face above, via a tricky mantle.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Switchblade
problems.description: Start, and climb, as per "The Shiv", but extend the lip traverse all the way left to the blunt arete.  Upon reaching the arete, continue up the slab above.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: The Shiv
problems.description: Sit-start under nose of boulder, using opposing slopers.  Gain the lip of the boulder, and move slightly left to top out.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: KOA
problems.description:
Technically in Riverside Area, this boulder facing south  is on your left on the way past Fossil Fool to the westernmost river crossing used to get to Pilgrimage. Stand-start under apex of boulder. Climb up on obvious good edges. V0 variations possible left and right. 
Not a destination boulder. Do it if you are passing by on the way to Pilgrimage or camping. (FA Dan Anhorn 2015)

problems.name: Noodle left
problems.description: V3ish.  Sit-start under arete using low finger-jug on the left, and right-hand on the left start-hold of "Magic Carp direct".  Move up and left, topping out by pressing up and left onto the descent ramp.

problems.name: Noodle right
problems.description: V3ish.  Start as per "Noodle left", but head right after the first few moves, into the topout of "Magic Carp".

problems.name: Magic Carp Direct
problems.description: Sit/crouch-start using pair of obvious, large edges..  Head straight up. (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Magic Carp
problems.description: Stand-start with a jug in the speckled dihedral. Climb left on side-pulls, and head up the more solid looking face, with a few tricky moves to the top. (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Magic Carp Right
problems.description: V4ish.  Start as per "Magic Carp", but head directly up the compression feature, after the first few moves.

problems.name: The Angler
problems.description: V1+.  Stand-start just right of "Magic Carp", using a left-hand crimp at head-height on the slab, and a lower right-hand sloper.  Move up and right, along the leaning slab.  Top out right.

problems.name: The Fisher King sit-start
problems.description: V7+.  Sit-start using two obvious, low jug-edges.  Move up and right to gain the long crimp-rail, then up and left to the mantle in the scoop.

problems.name: The Fisher King
problems.description: V6.  Stand-start using good edges/jugs near arete.  Move up and left to a long, thin crimp rail, then way up and left to a jug-edge over the lip.  A tricky mantle into the scoop follows.

problems.name: Pilgrim's Progress
problems.description:
Start left of the descent ramp hop-off on good LH and RH sidepulls. Make a few moves leftwards until you are able to get out to the arete and tip back right onto the slab with a crimp. Tricky!  (FA Mark Derksen 2014)  

EDIT 2015: a key crimp has broken leaving the grade or viability of this route in question.

problems.name: Noodle left
problems.description: V3ish.  Sit-start under arete using low finger-jug on the left, and right-hand on the left start-hold of "Magic Carp direct".  Move up and left, topping out by pressing up and left onto the descent ramp.

problems.name: Noodle right
problems.description: V3ish.  Start as per "Noodle left", but head right after the first few moves, into the topout of "Magic Carp".

problems.name: The River King
problems.description: Stand-start, matched on huge edge/sloper.  Head up and slightly right, through huge, sloping shelves. (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Pantless
problems.description: Sit-start matched on the perfect ledge.  Move up into solid side-pulls and ledges all the way up. (FA Mark Derksen 2014)

problems.name: Bait and Switch
problems.description: V6ish.  Sit-start matched on low, large edge.  Traverse low and right, joining "The Tempest".

problems.name: The Fisher's Mark
problems.description: V1.  Start on a good, high edge.  Exit either left (into Pantless) or right (better).  (FA Trent Hoover, 2017)

problems.name: The Tempest
problems.description: Sit start in pit with  double underclings. Use great edges and side-pulls  to get to a mantle that is not a gimme. (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Hook
problems.description: V3ish.  Sit-start as per "Fisher King sit".  Move up and left to a large, flat jug, then traverse left into "The Fisher's Mark" or "Pantless".

problems.name: The Fisher King sit-start
problems.description: V7+.  Sit-start using two obvious, low jug-edges.  Move up and right to gain the long crimp-rail, then up and left to the mantle in the scoop.

problems.name: The Fisher King
problems.description: V6.  Stand-start using good edges/jugs near arete.  Move up and left to a long, thin crimp rail, then way up and left to a jug-edge over the lip.  A tricky mantle into the scoop follows.

problems.name: Catch and Release
problems.description: V5/6.  Sit-start matched on sloping edge.  Move up and right, heading for the groove on the slab.

problems.name: Mark's problem
problems.description: V5.  Crouch/sit-start matched on edge.  Move up and slightly left, heading for the groove on the slab.  (FA Mark Derksen)

problems.name: The Deadliest Catch low
problems.description: V5+.  Sit-start matched on long edge (as per unnamed V5), and move up and right to join "Deadliest Catch".

problems.name: The Deadliest Catch
problems.description: V3 to V5 range.  Stand-start by stepping onto the left-side of the scooped slab, using obvious right-hand mini-jug, and whatever you like for your left.  Move up and left via some tricky holds, a committing high-step, and an exhilarating finish.

problems.name: Achelous
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start matched on low shelf/edge-complex.  Move up the tall slab above.

problems.name: Cast Away
problems.description: V5ish.  Sit-start as per "Achelous", but move diagonally up and right using right-hand crimps and left-hand slopers/pinches, to join the top of "River King".  Technical and balancy on cool holds.

problems.name: A River Runs Through It
problems.description: V9ish.  Sit-start in small pit, using a good, vertical right-hand edge, and a left-hand gaston.  Cross left-hand up to a small crimp, and reach right to a pinch on the blunt corner.  Bump to the large, diagonal shelf, then continue into the top of "River King".

problems.name: The River King
problems.description: Stand-start, matched on huge edge/sloper.  Head up and slightly right, through huge, sloping shelves. (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Voyageur low
problems.description: V8+.  Sit-start as per "Magnesis low", and head up and right to join and finish on "Voyageur".

problems.name: Magnesis low
problems.description: V5.  Start very low, with obvious, thin right-hand crimp, and very low block on the arete (very near adjacent bloc).  A couple of moves lead to "Magnesis".  (FA Trent Hoover, 2017)

problems.name: Voyageur
problems.description: V7ish.  Sit-start matched on triangular jug at far left of face.  Follow slopey rails right to gain, and finish up, the arete.

problems.name: Magnesis
problems.description: V3.  Start as per "Voyageur", but head up and left to the arete.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2017)

problems.name: Stasis
problems.description: V3/4.  Sit-start using blocky jug for left-hand, and lower incut sidepull for right-hand.  Move up the left side of the arete, before rolling right to finish.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2017)

problems.name: Stasis
problems.description: V3/4.  Sit-start using blocky jug for left-hand, and lower incut sidepull for right-hand.  Move up the left side of the arete, before rolling right to finish.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2017)

problems.name: Lodge
problems.description: V1. Sit start under "wedge" overhang, left hand side-pull, right hand head-height crimp. Pull up onto slab, top out straight up. (FA Dan Anhorn, 2017)

problems.name: Breath of the Wild
problems.description: V0.  Climb the natural line to the peak of the slab.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2017)

problems.name: The Dock
problems.description: V2. Start  left hand on a small incut edge at chest height, and right hand on finger jug. Climb up and left along good holds, using leaning arete to topout. Be prepared for a difficult descent. (FA Trent Hoover, 2017)

problems.name: The Sweet Science
problems.description: V6ish.  Sit-start matched on obvious incut edge.  A powerful move up and left to a good sloper on the lip is followed by a tricky and committing topout.

problems.name: The Clinch
problems.description: V4ish.  Sit-start under overhanging side of arete, using a triangular right-hand pinch in the overhang, and left-hand compressing the arete slightly lower.  Climb the steep side of the arete at first, before rolling left to gain a juggy edge.  Top out left or right from there.

problems.name: The Clinch
problems.description: V4ish.  Sit-start under overhanging side of arete, using a triangular right-hand pinch in the overhang, and left-hand compressing the arete slightly lower.  Climb the steep side of the arete at first, before rolling left to gain a juggy edge.  Top out left or right from there.

problems.name: The Contender
problems.description: V3ish.  Sit-start matched on left end of the dirty jug-rail.  Move left to good, pinchy edges, then continue up and left through some tricky moves.  Excellent moves on very cool holds.

problems.name: The Ali Shuffle
problems.description: V1ish.  Sit-start matched on dirty jug-rail.  Move up and right, using obvious undercling rail to gain the lip. Shuffle slightly left to top out.

problems.name: On the Ropes
problems.description: V4ish.  Stand-start using opposing edges (left-hand is high, right-hand is low).  Move up and left (using an inconspicuous hold) to gain the lip, then head right to top out.

problems.name: Pining for the Fords
problems.description: V1/2. Stand-start on left-hand side-pull edge and right-hand high edge. Balance straight up to a reach-y sloper move. Top out on two good holds. (FA Dan Anhorn, 2015)

problems.name: Windchime
problems.description: V3. Stand-start matched on rail. Move up through side-pulls and crimps to a tension crux and somewhat smooth top out. (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Doughball
problems.description: V0. Stand-start. Move up into concave area, and top out.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Snag n' Fly
problems.description: Sit-start.  Climb the center of the face.

problems.name: Holds Will Break
problems.description: Sit-start.  Climb right side of face, through slopey shelf.

problems.name: Snag n' Fly Arete
problems.description: Sit-start.  Climb the arete.

problems.name: FIght or Flight
problems.description: Up the slab, using the left arete.

problems.name: Don't Try This at Home
problems.description: Eliminate.  Climb the middle of the tall slab until you can grab the flat top (both aretes are out).  High, sequential, committing, and a bit fragile . . . you're likely to get more than you bargained for.

problems.name: Donkey Rocket
problems.description: Sit-start using right-facing sidepull/undercling feature.  Climb the tricky face above, without drifting left to the arete.

problems.name: Menstrual Crimps
problems.description: Sit-start using opposing sidepull edges, at the left end of the undercut feature.  Head up through thin, incut crimps.

problems.name: Coalbanks Revolution
problems.description: Sit-start on low, positive edges.  Highly interesting, enjoyable movement up the unique double-arete feature makes this one a gem at the grade!

problems.name: Leftist Revolution
problems.description: Sit-start.  Climb the left side of the arete.

problems.name: Prow Boulder Left Arete
problems.description: Sit-start.  Climb the arete.

problems.name: Bent Backwards
problems.description: Sit-start.  Climb the left side of the face.

problems.name: Straight Forward
problems.description: Sit-start.  Climb the middle of the face.

problems.name: G is for Grunt
problems.description: Sit-start using good, blocky holds.  Gun for big ledge.  Top out above.

problems.name: Prow Boulder Right Arete
problems.description: Sit-start.  Climb the arete.

problems.name: Little Trundle of Joy
problems.description: Located prominently up on a ridge, about 150-meters south-east of the Mushroom boulder (or 200-meters north-west of the Giant).  Sit-start matched on juggy, square-cut sidepull.  Power up and left on sloping rails and edges.  Top out the right side of the big scoop (relatively easy, but don't blow it!).

problems.name: Tombstone Left
problems.description: Sit-start with left hand on arete, right hand on diagonal sidepull in the face.  Climb up the overhanging arete.

problems.name: Skeleton Key
problems.description: Start as per "Tombstone Left".  Traverse right, and finish on "Tombstone Right".  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Tombstone Right
problems.description: Sit-start with left hand on sidepull jug, right hand on low sloper.  Climb up left side of arete.

problems.name: Gravedigger
problems.description: Start as per "Tombstone Right".  Head up and right, onto the slab.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Graveyard Shift
problems.description: Start as per "Tombstone Right", but traverse left through edges, and finish on "Tombstone Left".  (FA Trent Hoover, 2014)

problems.name: Nectarine
problems.description: Start as per "Chicken Little", but head up and left, onto the slab.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Chicken Little Arete
problems.description: Great line that follows a nice, clean feature to an exposed top out.  Sit-start using diagonal shelf.  Use the arete on your left and whatever you can on your right.

problems.name: Chrysalis
problems.description: Sit-start matched on flat jug.  Move up through edge, arete, and slab.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Thidwick
problems.description: Sit-start using low, juggy rail.  Head straight up to easy top out.

problems.name: Oobleck
problems.description: Sit-start low on good holds.  Head up through pinches, to a slopey mantle.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Yertle the Turtle
problems.description: Start low on right-hand sidepull/undercling, and left-hand sidepull just beside the start of "Oobleck". Using big left hand side pulls, head up and right to a sloping top out.

problems.name: Don't Blow It
problems.description: Sit-start using right undercling pinch, and left crimp.  Tricky moves straight up lead to an enaging topout.

problems.name: Wasp Overhang
problems.description: Start on huge, flat edge.  Head straight up.

problems.name: Ultra-Limestone Catastrophe
problems.description: Start as per "Limestone Catastrophe".  Head left, around corner, into dihedral.

problems.name: Limestone Catastrophe
problems.description: Sit-start using underside of protruding feature.  Head up and slightly right on comfy, rounded features.  Really good line.

problems.name: Ultra-Limestone Catastrophe
problems.description: Start as per "Limestone Catastrophe".  Head left, around corner, into dihedral.

problems.name: Limestone Catastrophe
problems.description: Sit-start using underside of protruding feature.  Head up and slightly right on comfy, rounded features.  Really good line.

problems.name: The Bowing Bishop
problems.description: Sit-start in alcove, using lowest crimps.  A couple of crimpy(!) moves gain large edges and easy topout.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Attack of the Pikas
problems.description: Start with large, good edges.  Climb the left side of the leaning arete.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Day of the Snake
problems.description: Sit-start using large, flat, sloper-edge.  Head up and left along crimps and slopers.(FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: The Smarter Garter
problems.description: Start as for "Day of the Snake", but head straight up on to the slab.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Contagious
problems.description: Start on huge two hand undercling. Move up to shelf, and top out.

problems.name: Otter Surprise
problems.description: Sit-start on good, angled rail.  Climb the face above.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Expected  Surprise Left
problems.description: Start as per "Expected Surprise".  Head up and left.

problems.name: Expected Surprise
problems.description: Sit-start matched on good, angled rail.  Climb the face up and right, towards a shelf at about two-thirds height.

problems.name: Worm Face
problems.description: Many V0 lines all over this interesting slab on the north face of Expected Surprise boulder.

problems.name: V for Victory
problems.description: Sit-start with left-hand on the bottom of the arête (the bottom of the V), and right-hand on a lower sidepull edge far to the right. Climb up with trickery.  Exit right using a big pinch.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: V for Valour
problems.description: Start as for "V For Victory", but head left at the lip, working feet up the ramp.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: X Factor
problems.description: Sit-start between two boulders, with hands on two crimps at face-height.  Climb straight up bulge on perfect holds.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2013)

problems.name: Blood Simple
problems.description: V8ish.  Stand-start using a sharp left-hand sidepull, and a smooth right-hand edge.  Power up the short face.

problems.name: Dyno or Die Now
problems.description: Sit-start using good rails/edges.  Head straight up, through another good, horizontal rail. (FA Kyle Marco, 2015)

problems.name: Paleface
problems.description: Start as per "Dyno, or Die Now", but move right and follow left-facing edges. (FA Kyle Marco, 2015)

problems.name: Paleface Low
problems.description: Start cramped on low holds below "Paleface". Finish as per that problem. (FA Morgan Dunnet, 2015)

problems.name: Strong Arm
problems.description: Sit-start using right-hand sidepull and left-hand gaston.  Move up and left to join "Paleface". (FA Tent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: Up in Arms
problems.description: Start as per "Strong Arm", but head straight up, gunning for a left-facing block. (FA Morgan Dunnet, 2015)

problems.name: Aisselle
problems.description: Start as per "Strong Arm", but head immediately right, following a line of crimps rising above the pit.

problems.name: Up in Arms Low
problems.description: Stand-start in pit, using low, left-hand sidepull and pocketed right-hand edge.  Move up and left to finish on "Up in Arms".

problems.name: Les Profondeurs de l'Aisselle
problems.description: V8.  Start, and climb, as per "Up In Arms low".  Join "Aisselle" at its start, and finish up that problem.

problems.name: Les Profondeurs de l'Aisselle direct
problems.description: V9.  Stand-start in the pit, using a high, small karst sidepull/pinch for your right-hand, and anything lower for your left.  Climb directly up the tall face, through a slick series of sidepulls, crimps, and smears.

problems.name: Swashbuckling
problems.description: V0.  Start at the far left end up the lip.  Traverse right, along the lip, sticking to the lower rail/tier, until you can join "Rapier" to top out.

problems.name: Touche
problems.description: Sit-start using slightly underclinging karst slot for your left-hand, and a crimp for your right.  Head straight up.

problems.name: Parry
problems.description: V1.  Sit-start using good diagonal rail.  Move up and left using right-facing holds.

problems.name: Riposte
problems.description: Sit-start as per "Parry", but traverse up and right, to join "Rapier".

problems.name: Thrust
problems.description: V3.  Sit-start in pit, matched on good edge.  Climb up and left.

problems.name: Rapier
problems.description: Sit-start using a right-hand sidepull and a huge foothold. Follow edges up to the dihedral feature, and follow that to top out. (FA Kyle Marco, 2015)

problems.name: Crossing Swords
problems.description: Start as per "Buckler".  Complete a thin, balancy traverse directly into "Mach3".

problems.name: Buckler
problems.description: Sit-start using right-hand sidepull and left-hand slopey dish.  Gun for obvious angled edge, high and right. (FA Morgan Dunnet, 2015)

problems.name: Mach3
problems.description: Sit-start using good right-hand sidepull, and low left-hand crimp-rail.  Head up and slightly left, though very thin edges.

problems.name: Scoured
problems.description: Sit-start with left-hand on arete, and right-hand near top of blunt rib/rail feature.  Climb the right side of the arete.

problems.name: Leg Adjacent to an Angle
problems.description: Sit-start on left of pit/overhang, left-hand on perfect crescent edge, right-hand on gaston/edge in crack.  Reach up to crimps/edges to pull to peak of boulder. (FA Dan Anhorn, 2015)

problems.name: Trig left
problems.description: Start as per "Flow", but head up and left.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2015)

problems.name: Trig right
problems.description: Start as per "Flow", but head up and slightly right.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2015)

problems.name: Flow
problems.description: Sit-start at far left end of pit.  Traverse low and right, to join the finish of "Flux". (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Flux
problems.description: Sit-start low in cave, right-hand anywhere on the large sloper-rail, left-hand low on a blunt pinch. Power up and right.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2015)

problems.name: Nowhere Man
problems.description: Start as per "Going Nowhere", but head up and left to gain good edges.  Reach right to top out.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Going Nowhere
problems.description: Sit-start using high left-hand sidepull, and an edge or pinch low in the cave for your right-hand.  Move up and right, through crimps, to top.

problems.name: Nowhere
problems.description: Sit-start on massive jug block.  Move left to undercling rail, then up the arete above.  An alternate start can be done starting matched on the undercling rail (same grade).

problems.name: Nowhere right
problems.description: Start as per "Nowhere", but move up and right, climbing the face right of the arete.

problems.name: Nowhere Dihedral
problems.description: Start, and climb, as per "Nowhere right", but continue right, to some fun pressing up the dihedral.

problems.name: Middle of Nowhere
problems.description: Crouch-start, matched on low opposing sidepulls.  Climb directly up, using large shelf, and massive left sidepull rail/arete.

problems.name: Riddle of Nowhere
problems.description: Start on lowest good holds between "Middle of Nowhere" and the right arete.  Climb face direct, through a good edge.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Diddle of Nowhere
problems.description: Start on lowest good holds by arete.  Climb the left side of the arete.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Wastelands
problems.description: Sit-start using low shelf.  Climb carefully up face, using arete to your left.

problems.name: Wastelands right
problems.description: Start as per "Wastelands", but head up and right to a pair of shelves.  Press up onto slab above, using the corner up and left.

problems.name: Slippery Slope
problems.description: Sit-start st middle of scooped slab, using a blunt right-hand sidepull, and one of two small crimps for your left.  Climb directly up the rounded, precarious slab above.

problems.name: Rhinoplasty
problems.description: Sit-start under arete, left-hand on arete, right-hand on crimp.  Climb up arete.  (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Butterfly Effect
problems.description: V9ish.  Sit-start matched on obvious edge low in middle of face.  Make a long move up and right to a sloping crimp, a tricky sloper/pinch, and a desperate finish.

problems.name: Cirque du Soleil
problems.description: V2ish.  Sit-start using low right-facing edges.  Move up and left.

problems.name: Dive Bar
problems.description: Located approximately 25 meters south of "Nowhere".  Sit-start under sloping shelf in cave, with left-hand pinching arete, and right-hand on a blunt sidepull.  Move up and left, to huge jug, then up to topout.

problems.name: Amtal Rule
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start using large left-hand sidepull, and anything lower for right-hand.  Climb up and onto ramp, then up and over lip.

problems.name: Crysknife
problems.description: V3/4.  Sit-start, and climb directly up centre of face.

problems.name: Fedaykin
problems.description: V0.  Sit-start using corner feature under arete.  Climb up to arete, and follow its left side to the peak of the boulder.

problems.name: Kwisatz Haderach
problems.description: V6.  Start, and climb, as per "Bi-La Kaifa", but roll onto the slab at the midpoint of the lip traverse.

problems.name: Bi-La Kaifa
problems.description: V6.  Start as per "Ayat".  Upon gaining the lip, traverse left, topping out at the far left end.

problems.name: Burhan
problems.description: V2.  Start as per "Ayat", but head directly up onto slab.

problems.name: Ayat
problems.description: V1.  Sit-start at base of arete, using low left-hand sidepull, and right-hand on one of the blocky holds.  Move up to lip, then traverse right, to join "Amtal Rule".

problems.name: Amtal Rule
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start using large left-hand sidepull, and anything lower for right-hand.  Climb up and onto ramp, then up and over lip.

problems.name: Maud ' Dib
problems.description: V8/9.  Stand-start, matched on pinch on lip.  Traverse lip all the way left, topping out at arete.  The lower boulder (the start of "Usul") is not used in this problem.

problems.name: Usul
problems.description: V7/8.  Sit-start, matched on large horn jug on detached bloc.  Move up and into "Maud ' Dib".  Easier because the start jug provides a large foot that is not part of "Maud 'Dib".

problems.name: Ithaqua
problems.description: V6/7.  Start matched on edge at far left end of lip.  Move up and right to lip, then continue traversing the lip all the way right, into the finish of "Wendigo".

problems.name: Wechuge
problems.description: V5.  Start down and left from "Windigo", with right-hand undercling in roof-crack, and left-hand on wide, slopey rail.  Head up and left, along lip of boulder, eventually gaining a left-hand arete feature on the slab.

problems.name: Windigo
problems.description: V5.  Start right-hand on incut sidepull above lip, left-hand on lower, flat edge.  Climb up and right on sloping and rounded holds.  (FA Trent Hoover, 2015)

problems.name: Guyline
problems.description: V7.  Start with right-hand pinching slopey corner of large rail, and left-hand on a higher slopey edge.  Head straight up.

problems.name: The Wind and the Wizard low
problems.description: V7.  Sit-start with opposing sidepull rails low in overhang (left-hand rail is higher).  A couple of powerful/tensiony moves link into the regular "Wind and the Wizard" sequence.

problems.name: Telekinesis Low
problems.description: V7/8.  Start as per "Wind and the WIzard low", and join "Telekinesis".

problems.name: Telekinesis
problems.description: V6/7.  Start as per "Wind and the Wizard".  Gain holds above the lip of the overhang, and traverse left, topping-out in the same place as "Guyline".

problems.name: The Wind and the Wizard
problems.description: V5.  Start matched on good edge below lip.  Head up and right.  (FA Kyle Marco)

problems.name: Windwalker
problems.description: V1.  Sit-start matched on obvious juggy edge in overhang.  Move up and right, to right-facing corner feature, using this to press further right onto short slab.

problems.name: Windwalker direct
problems.description: V2.  Start as per "Windwalker", but climb the slab directly above, using the corner feature on your right.

problems.name: The Empire Strikes Back
problems.description: Sit-start and traverse the rising lip from left to right.

problems.name: Sith Lord
problems.description: Sit-start under right arete/lip, and head straight up, using undercling block.

problems.name: Tusk
problems.description: Crouch-start using obvious pocket/pod on right side of prow, and sloping edge at the same height on the left side of the prow.  A very dabby, frustrating first couple of moves lead to wonderful compression climbing up the overhanging dagger.

problems.name: The Outer Limits
problems.description: V4ish.  Sit-start at left side of base of dihedral, using large, low, opposing edges.  Tricky start leads to fun moves heading up and slightly left.  Stand-start is good, V2ish problem.

problems.name: Awe and Mystery
problems.description: V5/6.  Sit-start as per "The Outer Limits".  Move up and right, through dihedral, to gain right arete.  Finish up arete.  Stand-start with right hand on arete is a good V2ish problem.

problems.name: Watchtower arete
problems.description: Crouch-start, with left-hand on arete and right-hand on a lower crimp/edge in the face.  Climb the right side of the arete to the top of the boulder, then roll left to top out.

problems.name: Vigilance
problems.description: Crouch-start on low crimps/edges left of the start of "Lookout".  Move up and right to good edge rail, then continue right, eventually joining and finishing on "Sentinel".

problems.name: Be on Guard
problems.description: Start as per "Vigilance", and link into " The Watchtower ".

problems.name: Lookout
problems.description: Sit-start, matched on obvious shelf.  Head up and left, joining "Watchtower Arete".

problems.name: The Watchtower
problems.description: Sit-start, matched in obvious juggy hole.  Move up and right to large rail, then up and left, to the high right-facing arete feature.  Airy top out.

problems.name: Sentinel
problems.description: Start as per "The Watchtower", but continue right along the large rail, to top out on " Jack and Jill".

problems.name: Jack and Jill
problems.description: Sit-start, matched on low, crumbly jug shelf.  Head up and left towards left-facing arete feature.  Top out left.

problems.name: Romancing the Stone
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start with left-hand low on arete, and right-hand on a highly-textured edge in the overhang.  Climb up and right, along lip, to peak of the boulder. (FA Kyle Marco, 2015)

problems.name: Rising Tithes
problems.description: V7/8.  Sit-start at the far right end of the long lip.  Follow the lip up and left through a series of increasingly difficult moves.  (FA Evan Erickson, 2007)

problems.name: Ebb
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start using low right-hand pinch, and left-hand on a small undercling.  Move up through large, angled holds to a nice mantle. (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Backwater
problems.description: V1.  Sit-start under the bulgy feature in the corner of the cave area.  Move up and into the large blocky feature, and mantle above.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2014)

problems.name: Romancing the Stone
problems.description: V4.  Sit-start with left-hand low on arete, and right-hand on a highly-textured edge in the overhang.  Climb up and right, along lip, to peak of the boulder. (FA Kyle Marco, 2015)

problems.name: Rising Tithes
problems.description: V7/8.  Sit-start at the far right end of the long lip.  Follow the lip up and left through a series of increasingly difficult moves.  (FA Evan Erickson, 2007)

problems.name: Double Edge
problems.description: V2.  Sit-start in pit, with left-hand on small pyramidal sloper, and right-hand on big sidepull.  Negotiate the two edges to the top using tricky feet. (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)

problems.name: Single Edge
problems.description: V0.  Sit-start at base of arete and ascend directly. (FA Dan Anhorn, 2016)
V2.  Sit-start.  Climb the dirty dihedral.

problems.name: The Next Generation
problems.description: V6.  Sit-start using blunt left-hand undercling feature, and right-hand low on arete.  Climb the left-side of the slabby arete, away from the dihedral.  (FA Kyle Marco, 2016)

problems.name: The Final Frontier
problems.description: V5.  Sit-start in pit, with left-hand low on arete, and obvious right-hand crimp.  Climb the right side of the slabby arete.  (FA Mark Derksen, 2016)
